title: (x) Sacramento Kings - Narrowband Prime (mod) {Chesh}
content:
[http://pic7.picturetrail.com/VOL217/1035574/1936597/50569026.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143124/http:/pic7.picturetrail.com/VOL217/1035574/1936597/50569026.jpg)   
   
I am in desperate need of this font. Please, if you can, identify this font, and point me in the right direction.   
   
Thanks!
author: thegetdown

comments.content: In an earlier thread, the consensus was that the logo is a modified version of ICG Narrowband, or at least that was close enough. See the thread [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143124/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/10591.html).

Sorry, but the best you could do is [Image Club Narrowband](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143124/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=405922) to try to come close to that lettering. Now that I look at it, it's not too far off, but usually pro sports teams use custom lettering, so these kinds of 'desperate' requests will just be frustrating for all involved.   
   
Narrowband comes in 2 weights, but I picked the bold page.

Well, I don't mind modifications, I just didn't want to redraw it from scratch. I like to have a base to start.   
   
Thanks guys!!!

If all you need is a logo, [here's an alternate version](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143124/http:/web.brandsoftheworld.com/?id=112&query_id=3625680&page=1&brand_id=20643) than the jersey lettering.

Decco Moderne gives you a similar look as well.   
   
 [http://www.fontfinder.ws/353/Decco-Modern-Normal.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143124/http:/www.fontfinder.ws/353/Decco-Modern-Normal.html)
